subject: Cardiology

overview.definition: Irreversible myocardial necrosis due to prolonged ischemia.
overview.mechanism: Plaque rupture causes thrombus formation and coronary occlusion.
overview.golden_fact: Troponin I is the most specific marker of myocardial infarction.

sections.title: Clinical Features
content: Radiation to left arm or jaw

exam_pearls: Inferior wall MI often causes bradycardia due to RCA involvement.
mistakes: Troponin does not rise immediately after infarction.
